title: Eclipse33
author: Eclipse33
created_time: October 26, 2022, 09:14:39 PMLast edit: March 19, 2025, 05:19:39 PM by Eclipse33

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: "By working with Eclipse, you ensure you are receiving authenticated, investment grade, premier examples of physical cryptocurrency."By who and how has this coin been authenticated?What constitutes "investment grade"?

comments.author: dozerz
comments.body: should we be concerned by this?

comments.author: ezeminer
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on October 26, 2022, 09:57:20 PM 2. "Investment grade" constitutes pieces that fit a specific benchmark. Is the coin tarnished or is it mint state? was the public key leaked in the past? Is the coin created by a trusted creator? Is the chain of ownership known? So with that chain of ownership, would there be a PGP chain included that involves the transaction history of the coin from Lealana to you?

comments.author: ezeminer
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on October 27, 2022, 12:17:29 AMQuote from: ezeminer on October 26, 2022, 11:02:32 PMQuote from: Eclipse33 on October 26, 2022, 09:57:20 PM 2. "Investment grade" constitutes pieces that fit a specific benchmark. Is the coin tarnished or is it mint state? was the public key leaked in the past? Is the coin created by a trusted creator? Is the chain of ownership known? So with that chain of ownership, would there be a PGP chain included that involves the transaction history of the coin from Lealana to you?Whomever owned the piece in your collection before you is going to be just as important as who originally made the piece. Especially when it comes to the higher-end coins. A verifiable chain of ownership is going to be important to verify and maintain that the owner was trustworthy, and the piece was well maintained and kept properly secure. We are dealing with secure cryptocurrency storage instruments. These things are not to be taken lightly. Especially with this market subsegment gaining acclaim and going mainstream. A chain of ownership will ensure a buyer that they are receiving a legitimate and secure cryptocurrency storage instrument (what these pieces are at the fundamental level). ¬†Who wants to buy something that otherwise has the potential to be compromised or fake? With a chain of ownership, a buyer could determine the piece was legit. So, is that a yes or no to my question about the PGP chain of custody

comments.author: ezeminer
comments.body: Quote from: Eclipse33 on October 27, 2022, 12:29:08 AMThis particular coin does not have a PGP signed chain of custody. This coin was purchased on the secondary market, and I cannot provide chain of custody information. Sweet. Thank you for clarifying that!

comments.author: elmejorrematador
comments.body: Hey guys,Sorry, i am not familiar with PGP chain of custody. Most of the coins I bought were from back in 2017, did we have this back then? Is it really a concern? The person I bought from I think is known by some OG's here. Should I be doing something to document ownership of these coins?

comments.author: Humble Bitcoiners
comments.body: Who guarantees that the Maker itself doesn't scam you with the priv key?Imo it's all about trust and not about certificates.Working with trusted, friendly & helpful Bitcoiners here is the best cert you can get...my own humble opinionüòâüçÄ

comments.author: elmejorrematador
comments.body: Ok, I was just wondering if I had missed something. It would be nice to have some digital on chain records though that couldn't be altered or deleted.
